content.title: Skill Development Fee Reimbursement Scheme
content.department: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
content.beneficiary: Students who have completed an SPC-approved technical skill training program
content.details: Through the 'Skill Development Fee Reimbursement Scheme', the SPC will reimburse 50% of the fees up to ₹ 50,000/- to the students who have successfully completed an SPC-approved technical skill training program in any of the approved domains from a Goan educational institute.
benefits: Reimbursement of 50% of the fees up to ₹ 50,000/- to the students who have successfully completed an SPC-approved technical skill training program in any of the approved domains, attended in a Goan educational institute.
Up to 1000 students per year can avail the benefits of this scheme. However, this cap can be reviewed and revised based on the need in future.
A student can avail the benefits of this scheme for any two courses in a year.
eligibility: The applicant should be an educational institution.
The educational institute must be incorporated in Goa or have a registered place of business in Goa.

The technical skill training program must be approved by SPC and should fall under any of the technical domains: Internet of things, Artificial intelligence, Machine Learning, Interaction Design, Big Data Analytics, Robotics, 3-D Printing, Data Science, Drones, Virtual Reality/Augmented Reality/Merged Reality, Others (subject to approval from SPC).
The students who are currently pursuing their graduation or are within two years from receiving their graduate degree within the original stipulated period of study can enrol for these programs.
documents_required: Copy of SPC’s approval of the program
The form and documents as mentioned in Annexure 1

faqs.question: What happens if false information is provided in the application?
faqs.answer: If false information or fraudulent activity is found in connection with the application, the SPC may prohibit the applicant from availing of the scheme benefits.

faqs.question: What documents are required for claiming the incentive?
faqs.answer: The mandatory documents include Aadhaar card of the student, course completion certificate, copy of SPC's approval of the program, original proof of payment/fees receipt, and the completed application form.

faqs.question: How long does it take to process and approve applications?
faqs.answer: The SPC evaluates and notifies approval or rejection within 45 days from receipt of the application, and once approved, the amount is disbursed within 60 days from the date of approval.

faqs.question: Is there a specific time frame for applying for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply for this scheme at any time during the financial year, but only within 6 months of incurring the relevant expenditure.

faqs.question: Who has the authority to accept or reject claims filed by students?
faqs.answer: The SPC has the sole authority to accept or reject claims filed by students, and its decision is final and binding.

faqs.question: What expenses are considered for reimbursement under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Only expenses incurred after the notification of Goa Start-up Policy 2017, paid digitally, and within the policy's validity will be considered for reimbursement.

faqs.question: Can students currently pursuing graduation or those within two years of receiving their graduate degree apply for these programs?
faqs.answer: Yes, students within two years of completing their graduate degree can enroll for these programs.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for educational institutes?
faqs.answer: Educational institutes must be incorporated in Goa or have a registered place of business in Goa.

faqs.question: Who qualifies as a 'student' under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A 'student' can be someone born in Goa studying in Goa or elsewhere, a person with domicile in Goa for at least 10 years studying in Goa or elsewhere, or a person studying in educational institutes in Goa even if not a State domicile.

faqs.question: What is the definition of a 'Goan educational institute' for this scheme?
faqs.answer: A 'Goan educational institute' refers to an institute registered or operating in Goa.

faqs.question: Is the scheme an entitlement for all eligible students?
faqs.answer: No, the benefits are not considered entitlements. The Startup Promotion Cell (SPC) reserves the right to accept or reject applications.

faqs.question: Can a student avail of the benefits for more than two courses in a year?
faqs.answer: No, a student can only avail of the benefits for a maximum of two courses in a year.

faqs.question: How many students can benefit from this scheme each year?
faqs.answer: Up to 1000 students can benefit from this scheme annually, but this cap can be reviewed and revised if necessary.
